text: Troy Shondell (born Gary Wayne Schelton; May 14, 1939 - January 7, 2016) was an American singer. His career began in 1957 and he was most famous during the 1960s. He was best known for his 1961 rock and roll single "This Time (We're Really Breaking Up)". The song made the record charts in both the United States and the United Kingdom. Shondell was born in Fort Wayne, Indiana. He was married to Trina Shondell. Shondell had Alzheimer's disease and Parkinson's disease. He died from problems caused by the diseases on January 7, 2016 in Picayune, Mississippi. He was 76. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1939 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American pop singers Category:American rock singers Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Mississippi Category:Musicians from Indiana Category:People from Fort Wayne, Indiana
title: Troy Shondell
